full_text:
Solidarity with our Muslim, Jewish, migrant and LGBT+ brothers and sisters in France facing the terrifying prospect of a historic advance for the far-right today. 

Marine Le Pen must see the same fate as her fascist predecessors: defeat. 

No pasaran ✊🏽

Beautiful sunshine for doorknocking today, speaking to residents in Wainbody with Des Arthur, who is standing against a Tory councillor in May.

Des will be a powerful voice for local residents and it was a pleasure to campaign alongside him today 🌹 https://t.co/ZFH8V1H8lx

Earlier this week Rishi Sunak suggested his wife would have to “sever ties” with India if she stopped exploiting this tax loophole. She (obviously) hasn’t had to do this.

So were you lying, @RishiSunak, or are you just so out of touch you didn’t know the rules? https://t.co/abakanz4fH
Rishi Sunak should resign.

So Rishi Sunak *did* have a US Green Card whilst being Chancellor. That means he declared himself to be a permanent resident in the US.

He's been ready to swan-off to his California home if being an MP didn't suit him.

Politics is just a hobby for these super-rich charlatans.

Politics isn't a spectator sport. If you want to change something, you've got to get involved.

That was my message to a great group of students at Westwood Academy, who I joined this week to speak about being an MP and how politics shapes all our lives ☺️ https://t.co/YYTeJ5uuYl

MPs who are responsible for closing tax avoidance loopholes shouldn’t be allowed to benefit from tax avoidance loopholes. 

That really doesn't seem that controversial, does it?

The climate crisis is already wreaking havoc across the globe, but young people's futures are most at risk.

That's why youth groups like @GNDRising are leading the fight for climate and social justice.

Earlier this week I joined them at Coventry University to speak about this. https://t.co/CBjYFcNTJp

Boris Johnson's refusal to ban trans conversion therapy is another example of him fanning the flames of hate in an attempt to divide-and-rule.
 
This cruel, callous and calculated tactic can be defeated by showing him that our solidarity is stronger than their hate. #LGBWithTheT

Rishi Sunak's billionaire wife claims "non-dom" tax status, a loophole used by the super-rich to avoid paying millions of pounds of tax in Britain.

Meanwhile Sunak writes the tax rules and lets the super-rich exploit this loophole.

They really are taking the piss.

Joram is a veteran who was scarred by his time on the frontline.

He's rebuilding his life in Coventry, but disgracefully the Home Office is trying to deport him to a country where he's at risk of torture.

Thanks to the @NewStatesman for telling his story:https://t.co/1boizw4GXu

The Tories let Shell pay *zero* tax on North Sea oil and gas production last year. Instead the Treasury actually paid them £92,000,000!

In contrast, Shell paid the Norwegian government £3,400,000,000.

We should tax companies like Shell and use that to slash energy bills.

The Tories have today hiked National Insurance – hitting workers with higher taxes just as the costs of living soar  – but refused to put a wealth tax on the super-rich.

That tells you who they really serve: The wealthy few, not the struggling majority.

Rishi Sunak will help his old £43,000-a-year boarding school, but not families who can't afford to heat their homes.

That tells you everything about whose side he's really on. https://t.co/jmhYCQrsmp

The Tories' plan to privatise Channel 4 has nothing to do with it competing with Netflix.

It has everything to do with neutering critical reporting and trashing public service broadcasting.

It's cultural vandalism and must be opposed.

To avert climate chaos, we need to transition from deadly fossil fuels to a sustainable, greener future, delivering climate and social justice.

I'm joining @GNDRising this evening to launch their plan for how young people can make this happen.

Sign-up: https://t.co/bk9pXInuzN https://t.co/j7lmvDyWKL

Priti Patel has just accepted a £100,000 donation from one of the world’s leading oil traders.

She has also opposed using a windfall tax on oil companies’ profits to slash energy bills.

We need to kick big money and fossil fuel industry lobbyists out of our politics.
@naomi_desouza 🥭🤤 on behalf of mango-lovers in Coventry (and beyond), thank you for giving the best fruit the recognition it deserves!
@ShellyAsquith @UniversityLeeds @StrathclydeUCU @leedsucu Congradulations Shelly! 💘🎓
@GuzKhanOfficial Khair Mubarak bestie! 💫✌🏽

The most beautiful, blessed month is before us: Ramadan Mubarak! 

Wishing everyone a peaceful and spiritually nourishing #Ramadan. May Allah SWT accept all of our efforts and acts of worship, and may we become the best versions of ourselves 💚

Covid infections have just hit an all-time high in England, on the very same day the Tories have scrapped free tests for most people.

That's not "living with Covid". It's showing disregard for public health and abandoning the poorest.

Today – as the Tories let the cost-of-living crisis intensify and push people into poverty – MPs are getting a £2,200 pay rise.

I've rejected this and am donating mine to the local foodbank and groups supporting refugees.

Ordinary workers need a pay rise, not well-paid MPs.

Fossil fuel giants Shell and BP are set to make £40,000,000,000 in profits this year. Last year the "Big Six" energy companies made £1,000,000,000+.

The Tories are choosing to squeeze your living standards, not their profits. That's whose side they're on.

The Tories are letting energy bills soar by 54% today, up nearly £700.

In France, where energy companies are publicly owned, the government is only allowing a 4% rise.

Bring energy companies into public ownership and run them for our need, not corporate greed.

Today – of all days – it would have been good for the media to have centred trans people, rather than stoking-up a confected row with questions about genitalia.

But clearly that was too much to ask. #TransDayOfVisibility

And truth is, hospital parking charges for staff were reintroduced at some NHS Trusts way back in 2020. We only got that partially reversed in Coventry after I led a campaign calling on the government to keep their promise and give staff free parking throughout the pandemic.

Staff, patients and visitors get free parking at NHS hospitals in Scotland and Wales.

In England, the Tories are scrapping free parking for NHS staff tomorrow.

Anyone else think we should follow the lead of Scotland and Wales and scrap hospital parking charges in England too?
Today in Parliament I paid tribute to an award-winning group in my constituency, who support language learning in Coventry @CovLanguages 🥰 https://t.co/UGFy7u15m8

Joram has rebuilt in life in Coventry and he has no connections in Zimbabwe, where he is at risk of torture if he returns. Yet that's where the Home Office is seeking to deport him.

I've called on the Ministry of Defence to stop this unjust deportation.
https://t.co/YH2C50lpdv
@OliDugmore @PoliticsJOE_UK Congrats on being shortlisted, Oli! Third time’s the charm! 😎

I'll always stand-up for workers in Coventry South and for working class communities across the country 👊🏽

https://t.co/QizwqXCt6U

Staff at Liberty Pressing Solutions in Coventry are skilled workers with decades of experience. But their jobs are at risk, just as the cost-of-living crisis intensifies.

This week I called on the government to be proactive in protecting these jobs and our manufacturing base: https://t.co/Tmm84hvjsM

So proud to see Coventry City of Languages win the UK Parliament Community Campaign of the Year Award!

I met with Anna and Vicky before the campaign had started and it’s been so exciting to see it grow! Congratulations to the team! https://t.co/dOys88snRC
@catttt_lee This is such exciting news, Caitlin! Rooting for you 💯! ✊🏽
@ashleyrpz Sorry about this, Ashley! Looking into this to get it fixed 🤓

Today I again appealed on the government to stop a constituent being deported:

He arrived in Britain in 2001, joined the army, and served on the frontline – where he developed PTSD. He was scarred, but he served his time and rebuilt his life in Coventry. He mustn't be deported. https://t.co/kVwP1uNz6S

Wow. Since Friday more than 1,000 of you have donated! Thank you all so much!!

If you haven't yet, please join them if you can: you'll be helping me take on the Tories and their billionaire donors 👊🏽  https://t.co/IM4JBnCPpQ https://t.co/OTO4r67efZ

I had a lovely time dropping into the newly-opened St Martin's Community Cafe in Finham last week, hearing about the work they're doing to welcome local residents and be environmentally sustainable – even refashioning old oak pews into tables! Love the "Hope" carving outside too! https://t.co/3zmO3FYQ92
@DawnButlerBrent Love and solidarity, Dawn! Your courage and determination is an example for us all 💕
A busy weekend out door-knocking in Coventry: Binley, Hillfields, and Earlsdon all in one weekend! Great to speak to local residents and pick up constituency casework ☺️ https://t.co/1BTvoho1Cp

I'm determined to be a voice for young people and I love visiting schools in the constituency to talk about politics.

That's why it was such a pleasure to speak to students at Blue Coat School today (where the pupils gave me a gift bag of chocolates and roses – thank you! 🥺❤️) https://t.co/fsylsMYwAP

This creep at the Islamophobic, billionaire-owned @Spectator writes about me almost every month. I wonder what it is about me he doesn't like? 🤔

If you want me to continue living rent-free in his head, donate! https://t.co/IM4JBnCPpQ https://t.co/s3n8mdBgtO

Last night I had the privilege of joining Coventry Youth Activists, talking about politics, campaigning, and their drive to stop online abuse.

Thank you so much for having me, @CovActivists! 💖 https://t.co/Y2qLJpoqCy

And we can only win in Coventry South with a people-powered campaign, so sign-up to volunteer:

https://t.co/19KWAeR5dH

The seat I represent is a hyper-marginal and at the next election the Tories are going to throw everything at me.

I need your help to win and to continue standing up for our principles in Parliament: https://t.co/IM4JBnCPpQ https://t.co/5EcqLZLnZK
Beautiful day to be out and about in Coventry, listening to people's concerns and picking-up casework ☀️ https://t.co/VP7OCKsWFT

Rishi Sunak is taking the piss.
https://t.co/oKUjOgk6T5
Well done to @AndyMcDonaldMP for holding him to account! 👊🏽

The way P&O's CEO casually admits his company broke the law speaks volumes:

The rich and powerful act like the rules don't apply to them.

But that's no surprise: The whole system has been rigged in their interests. That's got to change.
https://t.co/1fSEGjAbNH

I always find this striking:

Prime Minister: Old Etonian
Chancellor: Richest MP
Cabinet: Mainly privately educated
Tory Party: Funded by super-rich

But even as their policies hit the working class hardest, the media almost never mentions class when explaining what’s happening.

Rishi Sunak, the richest MP in Parliament, is pursuing policies that will push 500,000 children into absolute poverty and cause the biggest fall in living standards since records began.

He knows this but he’s doing it anyway.

This is Tory class war.

It’s no surprise that 55% of the British public support energy companies being brought into public ownership.

Running key sectors of the economy democratically, in the interests of the people — not private profiteers — is common sense.
Sunak talks about a supposed "£330 tax cut" as if that compensates for energy bills going up by nearly £700. He's got no idea what it's like for ordinary people.

BP and Shell are expected to make £40,000,000,000 in profits this year – at the same time as energy bills are rocketing.

Today I asked why Rishi Sunak won't impose a windfall tax on these companies to keep household bills down. https://t.co/eh9I5ba4bR

BP and Shell are set to make profits worth £40,000,000,000 this year.

Let's put a windfall tax on these companies and use that funding to stop energy bills rising.

When you hear Rishi Sunak speaking today, remember he's the richest MP in Parliament who has repeatedly voted to slash social security support for workers while cutting taxes for some of the wealthiest. 

Sunak is a super-rich Chancellor who works for the super-rich.

Rishi Sunak, the richest MP in Parliament, will today say he “understands” the plight of millions facing a cost of living crisis.

If he wanted, he could avert the coming wave of poverty and hardship.

For @tribunemagazine, I explain how:
https://t.co/leDGRrAg2Z

My message to the Chancellor ahead of the Spring Statement:

Squeeze the profits of the super-rich, not the livelihoods of ordinary people.
https://t.co/6fud478hvP

Tory MPs today voted to give the government power to:

- Strip citizenship without notice
- Ignore 1951 Refugee Convention
- Send asylum seeks to offshore detention camps
- Imprison (eg) Ukrainian refugees for 4 years if they arrive without the right papers

Utterly heartless.

Today I joined NHS staff, campaigners and colleagues to hand-in a petition to the Prime Minister ahead of the Spring Statement, demanding proper funding for our NHS, an end to privatisation, and a fair pay rise for NHS workers ✊🏽 #SOSNHS https://t.co/cPQV7h1UVW

Migrants and people of colour recognise what Nazanin is experiencing: Even if you're wronged – even if years are robbed from your life because the government refused to pay its debt – you're expected to be "grateful" for anything you get. It's as if we're second-class citizens.

Nazanin has expressed gratitude at being able to come home, but some people seem to think she should keep quiet about a government that refused to pay a debt that would have secured her release 6 years ago and a Prime Minister whose actions lengthened her ordeal. It's ridiculous.
@naomi_desouza @NCTJ_news @live_coventry Huge congratulations Naomi, this is so well deserved! 🥳

I’m very proud of this ☺️

https://t.co/uN2VCjFIwp

Make no mistake: The cost of living crisis is the result of Tory political choices.

My letter to the Chancellor ahead of the Spring Statement: https://t.co/A8YFEd7C0o

MPs just had the chance to vote to condemn P&O's sacking of 800 workers and to urgently outlaw fire and rehire, so that this can never happen again.

I voted for this, but not a single Tory MP did. Why?

The Tories are the side of the bosses, not the workers.
The case of Child Q again shows: The problem at the Metropolitan Police isn't "a few bad apples". It's institutional racism and misogyny. https://t.co/2DnnBpZwAa

Around 10 million people face food insecurity and the cost living crisis is making this injustice even worse.

That's why today I joined colleagues to deliver a letter written by @IanByrneMP, calling on the government to end this injustice and enshrine the #RightToFood into law. https://t.co/6ZAveoyJRH

Today MPs will vote on plans to outlaw Fire and Rehire, the disgraceful practice that is being used against 800 P&O workers.

Ahead of the vote I joined colleagues and the @RMTunion outside Parliament to show solidarity and to pledge to support the workers. 

#SaveOurSeafarers https://t.co/vR9e5yHakf

Even before the cost of living crisis, 14.5 million were in poverty in Britain.

That's why as well as demanding fundamental political change, I am so grateful to groups like Sky Blue Support, who I joined this weekend to distribute food to vulnerable people in Willenhall 💖 https://t.co/IZMpQtCBgC
Nowruz Mubarak to everyone celebrating the new year in Coventry South and beyond. Wishing you all a happy and prosperous #Nowruz! ✨

The horrific abuse of Child Q shows – once again – that the Met Police is rotten to its core with racism and misogyny. 

In light of this sickening incident, serious questions must be asked about safeguarding and the presence of police officers in our schools.
Wishing the Hindu community in Coventry South and across the world #HappyHoli !  May the Festival of Colours bring happiness, joy and peace to all! 🎉

Busy day in the constituency today: chatting to local residents about the cost of living crisis, small business owners about its impact on them, and the British @LiverTrust, who were in the city centre to promote healthy lifestyles and the importance of early diagnosis ☺️ https://t.co/8jSLSx7pKg

Foodbank use went up 2,612% while David Cameron was Prime Minister.

Apologise for that before you start posing for photos, @David_Cameron. https://t.co/99D5qCtHR2

Tory MP for Dover @NatalieElphicke attended a P&O demo today, but the workers weren't having it:

Natalie voted with the Tories to block a law to ban fire and rehire, which would stop bosses mistreating staff like at P&O.

Natalie left the demo to workers chanting "shame on you".
@KateOsborneMP Thanks Kate ❤️ https://t.co/nJq3yq31RJ
@BethWinterMP Thank you, Beth ❤️
Beautiful afternoon speaking to University of Warwick students and encouraging them to register to vote ✌🏽🌈 https://t.co/OIun0hlpse
My short acceptance speech at the MP of the Year Awards in Parliament last night: https://t.co/NG1yVAO9SR

Outrageous. P&O Ferries has just sacked its entire 800 crew members without warning and plans to replace them with even more exploited agency workers.

Solidarity with @RMTunion members standing up to this scandal.

The government must intervene to protect these jobs.

Remember the MPs second jobs scandal?

Tory MPs were caught getting paid £100,000s in second jobs while ignoring their constituents. The government said it would act and cap MPs' earnings.

Well guess what? They've secretly dropped those plans. 

Second jobs should be banned.

I wish a very happy #StPatricksDay to the Irish community in Coventry, across Britain, Ireland and the world! Lá Fhéile Pádraig sona dhaoibh! ☘️

I still believe in the manifesto promise I was elected on: To make St Patrick's Day a bank holiday, so we could enjoy the sun today!
Congratulations to my brilliant colleagues @IanByrneMP, @BellRibeiroAddy and @abenaopp who also won awards 🙌🏽

Tonight I was honoured to receive the Young People’s MP of the Year Award.

In Parliament, I was joined by some of the amazing young people who voted for me and promised to keep being a voice for under-represented communities 💖 #MPoftheYearAwards https://t.co/gHs757KR01

The New Zealand Labour government is slashing public transport fares by 50% to reduce the impact of the cost of living crisis.

Don't let anyone tell you we can't do anything to help struggling families.

In Parliament today I echoed the words of the late, great Tony Benn, who passed away 8 years ago this week.

As Putin unleashes the horrors of war on Ukraine, Benn's consistent anti-war, pro-refugee political tradition is needed more than ever ❤️ https://t.co/622XoAIWHb

The Tories are trying to blame the cost of living crisis on Putin's war on Ukraine. This is a lie.

Even before the war, energy bills, food prices, National Insurance, Council Tax and more were rising sharply. 

The cost of living crisis is the fault of the Tory government.

Shell and BP had profits of more than £20,000,000,000 last year.

And now energy bills are rocketing by nearly £700 next month, up 54%.

There's an alternative: A windfall tax on oil companies with the energy sector brought into public ownership, run for our need not their greed.

Today the Saudi regime executed 81 men, in the largest mass execution in its history. 

Yet Boris Johnson is about to visit Saudi Arabia to beg for more oil.

If the government really cared about human rights, it would end its cosy relationship with the Saudis.
@CWUnews @LabourMercedes @IanByrneMP @MatthewBrownLab @salford_mayor Gutted I’m not there! 😷🦠

When women wanted to mourn Sarah Everard, the Met refused a vigil & then violently arrested women who attended.

Today the High Court ruled that the Met's refusal was wrong, in a judgement highlighting the threats to the right to protest & the danger of the Tories' Police Bill.

Joram is a painter & decorator with 2 kids in Coventry. He's a veteran, who served in Afghanistan & Iraq, where he developed PTSD.

But he's at threat of deportation & last week was nearly deported in "error" to a country where he's at risk of torture.

My letter to the Minister: https://t.co/6LzVuO3RIW

I'm pleased Roman Abramovich has finally been sanctioned. Putin's brutal war shows why his ally should never have been allowed to own Chelsea.

But why doesn't this principle apply to the Saudi regime, which was allowed to buy Newcastle even as it wages a horrific war in Yemen?

Today MPs will vote on the Tories' National Insurance hike.

Annoyingly I've tested positive for Covid, so I'm not able to participate in this (I feel a bit rough, but I'll be back soon!).

If I could, I'd vote to raise taxes on the super-rich, not working people!

International Women's Day wasn't always used by corporations to whitewash their exploitation.

It's marked because generations of women organised and fought for their rights.

Shortly after I was elected, I wrote about #IWD for @tribunemagazine:
https://t.co/BjU4otXqOX

Congratulations Abi! I'm so sorry I couldn't join you as planned – I just tested positive for Covid and am having to self-isolate 😭

Best of luck with the rest of your studies! 🙌🏽 https://t.co/5eA1zi556c

At times like this voices for compassion and peace are more important than ever.

That's why I was proud to join the Bishop of Coventry this weekend at the Lord Mayor's Committee for Peace and Reconciliation, focusing on our duty to welcome refugees and the threat of nuclear war. https://t.co/T55sKO9V7B
Cute doorknocking team out in St Michael's today, speaking to residents and identifying issues I can help them with 😊❤️ https://t.co/k6QqA27M4m

Very surreal to see my portrait in @The_Herbert Gallery last night (alongside some familiar faces @GuzKhanOfficial 👀)!

Students from Barr's Hill School selected the portraits as part of an exhibition celebrating Coventry people. 

Thank you so much for including me! 🥺❤️ https://t.co/MVIsdPOQZV

Huge congratulations to @PauletteHamilto on winning in Erdington and becoming Birmingham’s first Black MP!

Looking forward to seeing you in Parliament 🙌🏽
@rosieamywatts @BH_Coventry @WahidMaryam So lovely to meet you Rosie, and thank you for all the work you do to make art more accessible to communities across Coventry 💕

Earlier this year it was reported that Boris Johnson could hand Gavin Williamson a knighthood "to keep skeletons in closet".

Well guess what?

Boris Johnson just handed Gavin Williamson a knighthood.

It's not well-paid MPs who should get a £2,200 pay rise. It's working people who are struggling with the Tory cost-of-living crisis.

That's why I am donating my pay rise to Coventry Foodbank and charities supporting refugees in the city.
https://t.co/8F0Ipfw0H9

Today, a year since Sarah Everard's brutal murder, the need to tackle male violence against women and girls remains just as vital.

My video with @DoubleDownNews from last year:

https://t.co/UtEN9jgMZj

This week a billionaire-owned right-wing newspaper smeared striking London Underground workers as "Putin apologists".

The rich and powerful use absurd smears like this to protect their privilege and attack trade unionists.

Solidarity to @RMTunion workers on strike! ✊🏽

I believe MPs getting a £2,200 pay rise is wrong and have pledged to donate mine to good causes in Coventry. 

I will give 50% of it to Coventry Foodbank.

I will give the other 50% to charities in Coventry supporting refugees, to help Ukrainians and all those fleeing brutal war.

Since I raised this, I'm pleased to say I have been informed that Jo's deportation has been "deferred".

But unjust deportations like this should be cancelled in their entirety. So I'll continue to push to stop Jo from being taken from his family and put at risk of persecution.

My constituent, Jo, was scarred by his time in the British army, but he served his time and rebuilt his life in Coventry.

Now the Home Office is set to deport him to Zimbabwe.

In Parliament this week, I raised his urgent case. https://t.co/P5YbiDE2lz

A no-fly zone in Ukraine would entail war between two nuclear-armed superpowers. That could easily mean armageddon.

That's why Boris Johnson is right to rule it out.

Pundits – desperate to appear "tough" – should stop irresponsibly agitating for this dangerous move.

Today the independent regulator said MPs will get a £2200 pay rise.

I believe this is wrong: Ordinary people are facing a Tory cost-of-living crisis. They should get a proper pay rise, not well-paid MPs.

That's why I will donate mine to Coventry Foodbank and other local causes.
It's horrific to hear reports that black and brown people have been prevented from fleeing Ukraine. All refugees – no matter their race or religion – must be provided with safety and security.

European neighbours have embraced an open door policy to Ukrainian refugees fleeing Putin's invasion.

To stand in full solidarity with the Ukrainian people, the British government should do the same.

#RefugeesWelcomeHere

Tonight MPs are voting on the Tories' Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill.

It's an attack on our democratic liberties and our right to peaceful protest.

I am voting against this Tory descent into authoritarianism.

Earlier this week I met up with Finham Women’s Institute to discuss the failure of leadership on climate from the Tory government.

I spoke about the urgent need for a Green New Deal which rapidly decarbonises our economy through public ownership and massive investment in jobs. https://t.co/frN1oMhg0l

It was great to visit Gurdwara Guru Nanak Parkash for a fantastic Cha Da Cup session.

We focused on domestic violence & addressing the stigma that means many suffer in silence. 

Events like this are so important: we can’t forget that 1 in 4 women experience DV in their lives. https://t.co/ntNSqZS4FP

What a nail-biting, heart-attack-inducing final! Congratulations Liverpool! First of many trophies for us this season, iA! 

❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ https://t.co/w1xrakfSzs

"The war with Ukraine is the shame of Russia", Sofya Rusova, co-chair of Russia’s Trade Union of Journalists.

Solidarity with incredibly courageous anti-war protestors in Russia who are risking repression to stand up for peace and against Putin's invasion of Ukraine ✊🏾 https://t.co/c3ZbkQK1oS
@BenWebbLFC Thank you Ben! ✊🏽

@IanByrneMP Thanks Ian ❤️🤍
@miqdaad Thanks for your support, Miqdaad ✊🏽

Thank you so much to everyone who has sent me messages of love, solidarity and support. It means the world. 

We won’t let abuse, smears, or death threats intimidate us into silence ✊🏽 https://t.co/uM0mvhPtBE
A plain-text version of this has been posted on my Facebook page: https://t.co/7dTk5ON3uJ

Today I received a death threat from someone calling me “Putin’s whore”. I am in no doubt this horrific attack is the result of misleading reports and press comments.

The environment this creates threatens the safety of public figures and narrows our democracy. My statement: https://t.co/cBJcTP8qn3

I send my solidarity to the people of Ukraine and to Ukrainians in Coventry and across Britain.

I call on the British government to provide safe passage for Ukrainians displaced by this conflict and to welcome them here in Britain. 2/2

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is deplorable. Putin must immediately withdraw Russian forces and cease his bombardment.

A failure to de-escalate risks an incredibly dangerous, wider conflict. To avoid this nightmare, efforts to find a diplomatic solution must intensify. 1/2

The National Union of Students was formative in my political journey and this evening in Parliament I joined members past and present to mark its centenary.

I'll always support a strong, campaigning and principled student movement 💪🏽 https://t.co/UxAylBSodI

@PeterGrantMP This happens so often that I genuinely can’t remember the last time I gave a speech in the chamber and it didn’t happen. Wonder what it is about me and what I say that they don’t like.. 🤷🏽‍♀️

Today the Tories voted for a law that would have banned local communities from supporting anti-apartheid campaigns in South Africa.

And this law threatens the rights of local communities to oppose injustices today. My speech on why I voted against it: https://t.co/zyzkFGaG2T

Boris Johnson just said workers should learn from Germany, where they "don't go to work when they're sick".

The proportion of workers' salary covered by sick pay is 100% in Germany. It's just 19% here.
